page.title: 05SALPERTON PARK
page.content: This Manor House faces westwards over an expanse of fields and coppices.There is a long drive up to the classical eighteenth century mansion,situated half a mile from the village.The house itself was altered in the nineteenth century and now presents a dual appearance of classical front and cotswold-stone cottages at right angles to the rear ,dating from the sixteenth century. It has not always been a private residence but has served as a hotel,a social club and also as flats.At present the house is undergoing extensive renovation for the new owner.Any appreciation of the building is lost in scaffolding and building materials.
